website_summaries.verdict: You won't forget to don these flashy protective gloves the next time you retrieve a casserole from the oven.
pros: The gloves are long so they not only protect the fingers but the wrists, as well
Dishwasher-safe and made of sturdy silicon
Users felt sizing was accurate and liked that the gloves were flexible
Good for temperatures up to 400º F, and the material is waterproof
cons: Some users noted that the silicon feels slippery when holding certain cooking vessels

website_summaries.verdict: Tough, heat-resistant gloves that won't slip and can be washed with the rest of your dishes when it's time to clean up.
pros: Nonslip grips and extra-long cuffs to prevent burns
cons: These gloves absorb heat if you're holding hot items for long periods of time

customer_reviews.title: Burnt Fingers First Use at 350 degrees
customer_reviews.text: These are rated for over 400 degrees. First time use, moving an oven rack at 350 and I started to feel the heat within a few seconds. Suddenly the glove became extremely hot and couldn't get the glove off quick enough. It seems as though the glove stayed hot after dropping the rack and continued to burn my fingers. I don't understand all the positive reviews these don't work. Now I need to try something else. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: dstouten

customer_reviews.title: Company stands by their product
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought these gloves based on the wonderful reviews but after just a few weeks of use, both gloves split in seams near the webbing of the thumb. Well I reached out to the seller and they indicated that they have made improvements to the seams and that they would promptly send out a replacement set. The new gloves have been working exceeding well and allow me to grab hot potatoes from boiling water and easily grab pans out of the oven, all without feeling the uncomfortable heat.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Campbell

customer_reviews.title: not great for my intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: Despite the temperature rating in the description, I was still hoping it would work okay for handling my dutch oven. But unfortunately, the gloves really are not intended for that use. I can see how the gloves would work well for handling hot foods directly. But not suited for handling heavy cookware at high temperatures. When I reached out to the seller, I got great customer service though so I'm looking forward to trying other products from this same seller.
customer_reviews.author: aziansun

customer_reviews.title: Super Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I must say that I am super pleased with the customer service of this company! The original pair I ordered was too small for me, and so they sent a larger pair free of charge while letting me keep the previous pair which I let someone else use. Also, these seem super durable. From my experience with other brands, I have had others crack...thus making them no longer water or heat resistant in the cracks...not too much fun burning yourself or soaking your glove! Also, these gloves go almost half way up my arm, so I have the extra protection that I had not even thought about when I was purchasing them! Awesome product and customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing ... until they aren't. Beware of burns.
customer_reviews.text: These were really awesome for over 2 years. A little cumbersome, but then again you've got thick silicon gloves on. The flame “nubs” with 90-degree edges make it hard to clean them completely by hand quickly, but frankly, that's no big deal. However, I just burned myself on 450F oven racks with these on. Why? Because the silicon tore at the base of the thumb and the rest of the glove, and you don't realize that until it's too late. The kids got a kick out of my colorful language, though, so silver lining I guess. Sadly moving from a strongly recommend to recommend if you replace them annually.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Thrash

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: I don't like these at all. They have good ratings, but I'm not sure why. They are only acceptable for the shortest of uses, otherwise they start to conduct heat into your hands and you get burned. The other problem is that they are tight on your hands and difficult to get off. This is especially a problem when the gloves are greasy from handling food because the outside gets very slippery and they are almost impossible to remove. I never use these anymore because they are not effective at all. I would look to buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in all ways!!
customer_reviews.text: I have some other silicone products that withstand heat and I love them. So, when I saw these, I thought they would work well when we steam lobster. YES YES YES! I got the small size (would fit most women AND men) and they covered my hands and lower arms so the steam did not affect me at all. Made the job so much easier than trying to get the lobster out with tongs. Today, I plan to wear them to remove the 16 lb prime rib from its pan after I cook it. Have not tried it with the grill yet, but I am positive they will work great! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Burned my hands, they don’t work.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves don’t work, the heat comes through quickly, both my husband and I burned our hands using these. I carried the vegetable basket from my grill to the kitchen counter and my hands started burning about three seconds in. My husband burned his hands handling the grill rotisserie. What an epic fail! And, we didn’t use them right away so by the time we found out they don’t work the return window closed so now we’re stuck with these and out a chunk of our hard-earned money. :/
customer_reviews.author: StarshineMagic

customer_reviews.title: Just So-So Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to more easily be able to handle food on my grill and to clean my flat top griddle. The gloves allow a VERY limited window of opportunity to handle items that are extremely hot, including items under 425 degrees. Maybe I expected too much in that regard. Otherwise, they're slightly cumbersome to get on due to the material and length of the glove. I don't hate them enough to return, but I'd not buy them over a more heat resistant pair again.
customer_reviews.author: Dutty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grilling
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these gloves for a couple of weeks and use them several time a week while grilling/smoking on our green egg. They are certainly good at protecting my hands from the head but at the same time they are flexible enough that I can handle everything without feeling like I’m going to lose control. I’d also like to express my appreciation for their help when I ordered gloves that were too small. The company immediately sent replacement gloves as soon as I contacted them. I don’t often write reviews but this product is perfect for my use and their customer service is first class!
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Poehlitz

customer_reviews.title: Positive & Negative (not heat resistant enough for me)
customer_reviews.text: Bought these 3 years ago, use regularly. I use cast iron pans a lot, and cast iron dutch oven, but these gloves let too much heat through. They are okay for retrieving aluminium bakeware from oven. A seam between the thumb and fingers opened up, but after 3 years of regular use I won't complain about that. Still, I am on the hunt for a new pair of gloves. They are easy to clean - both inside and out with warm soapy water. They provide good grip, and the style - fingers, not mitts - is useful.
customer_reviews.author: AbiGezunt

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these gloves for 2 years and a hole developed between the thumb and forefinger. When I made the problem aware to the seller, they completely took care of me. I am really impressed with the great customer service this seller has should anything go wrong. Five stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great for saucy, hot ribs and other BBQ
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my Mom as a gift, and she loves them. They have their purpose: ribs. The ribs are always done in the oven, then taken out, sauced up, and thrown on the grill. These help to grab the hot, messy food; and make it possible to move from on and off the grill. Even if the sauce gets on the gloves, just put them in the dishwasher and they come out clean! Would also work great with smokers and other BBQ.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Renee

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves to use when grilling, and they are great for that, but I've found I love using them in the kitchen, too. They have replaced tongs for reaching into boiling water and pot holders for removing items from the oven. My hands are on the small side and when I first saw the gloves, I was sure they would be too big and bulky for me, but they are quite comfortable and easy to work with. I love that I can just keep them on my hands and wash them just like I'd wash my hands. I'll be buying more to give as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: They do an excellent job of protecting your hands
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves in anticipation of preparing a large turkey for thanksgiving. I cook my turkey breast side down and then turn it over so the breast can brown. I wanted to be able to turn the turkey over with out getting burned. I also wanted something to use when we smoked large cuts of meat on our smoker. The gloves worked wonderfully well with the turkey turning and expect they will be equally handy when I go back to smoking meat in the summer. They also worked well for removing the roasting pan from the oven. Great customer service with an excellent product that I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: lmazza888

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves For The Kitchen or Grill
customer_reviews.text: I have used these gloves to handle hot cast iron out of the oven and hot pans on the grill and they work great in both instances. They will eventually start to let heat through after about 2-3 minutes of continuous use, but I have not seen a silicone glove that doesn't do this after a while of heat exposure. The grippy bits on the gloves not only help you to hold onto hot objects, but also work great as a jar opener for those pesky stuck lids! The gloves are very flexible and allow for more hand and finger movement than most heat resistant gloves. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: SPW

customer_reviews.title: not what expected
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these to use at our fire company's chicken bbq dinner to handle the chicken halves. They were too small for anyone with hands larger than a medium to large size hand (most of our firemen have extra large hands). There is no insulation so they got very warm inside. Not hot from the chicken, just caused hands to sweat really bad. Won't be getting any more.
customer_reviews.author: Tina H

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Used these for the first time to pull apart my 190 degree pork shoulders. I won't say that my hands didn't get hot.. but I will say I did not have to go run my fingers under the cold water tap!! Pulled 15 pounds of pork apart in minutes, had to pause a couple of times to let my hands cool down, but I am guessing a pair of Bear Claws will fix that.. . I measured my hands prior to choosing glove size, would recommend you do the same to get a good fit.Great quality, heavy duty, slip resistant and the little nubs really help pulling the pork apart!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Gann

customer_reviews.title: terrible, burning hot, don't protect at all
customer_reviews.text: I've had these since January, tried to use multiple times, always end up grabbing kitchen towels because in about three seconds, the heat is searing through hot enough to burn. They're also way too huge for my hands, like clown shoes size. Total waste, threw in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: quadruplethreat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gloves, and available in sizes.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gloves. The individual fingers help when grabbing pans and handles. We also own the bigger, long style - the big guys who volunteer at the Soup Kitchen love them. Different sizes are important - ill-fitting gloves are a safety issue. Despite the fact that these are the best gloves we've used, my volunteers have still managed to break them at the thumb join. I still give these 4 stars because, if they were for personal use, you would be more careful with them. (We have moved to a mitt style that has no fingers; they have not yet broken any of those.) Photo shows Ekogrips hanging on our freezer.
customer_reviews.author: MBS

customer_reviews.title: Great product and even better service.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work very well around the grill, the oven or the stove. I can pull solid food out of boiling water. I can handle pans coming out of the oven without problems. I initially received the oversized gloves by mistake. I contacted the seller to arrange to exchange for the standard size. I received the correct size within 2 days with a note telling me not to worry about over sized gloves and to share them with some one with large hands. Wonderful service I have not seen in several decades. I would definitely use this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Order one size larger than you normally need. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Order one size larger than you normally need. The tacky nature of the material makes it hard to get your hand into if it is a normal size. Follow up: I upgraded my review due to customer service. Upon my review the seller immediately issued a refund because I was not satisfied, although it was really just an innocent issue. I'm highly impressed with the speed and level of customer. There is nothing wrong with the gloves, just buy up a size and you will be happy. Grilled with them this weekend. Hands get sweaty but they work well to protect from heat when opening the lid and gators in Florida.
customer_reviews.author: ECI-Tampa

customer_reviews.title: No discomfort handling hot handles with these
customer_reviews.text: These gloves make it possible for me to bring the cast iron skillet right off the grill and into the kitchen without risk of burns or discomfort. And the follow-up from customer service has been extremely polite. I would give the gloves a 5-star rating based on those two points alone; however, being a woman with small hands, the gloves are just a bit too large for me and therefore cumbersome for my fingers to bend easily or wrap securely around the handle of the skillet. I'm hoping they might become more flexible and easier for me to work with after more use. If they do, they'll get a 5-star rating from me for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepwalker

customer_reviews.title: Good But I Can Still Feel Heat
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I purchased these for grilling and neither of us are super thrilled with them. I can still feel heat through the glove when I'm pulling something a pan out of the hot oven and I've only had it in my hand for a few seconds. They are easy to maneuver in but if they don't protect from the heat, I'm not sure if they are worth it. I would not purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: SmooreTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: OBSESSED
customer_reviews.text: Writing for my husband: He's obsessed with them. Simple as that. Easy to grab meat out of smoker and gloves stay on hands because of the silicone material and textured material. Only complaint I have is that it's hard to wash at times, but it's such a small complaint because these gloves are truly amazing.
customer_reviews.author: rlzakutansky

customer_reviews.title: XXL is Average????
customer_reviews.text: I’m having a hard time understanding how XXL means “one size fits most”. There is no where to choose a size, so I’m thinking they may be a little large on me. XXL is like a pro football players hands. How is that size like most of us? Sorry. I wanted to like them but I’ll drop whatever hot burning thing I pick up if I use these giant gloves. There’s a problem here.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Maestro

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Thistle pulling gloves!
customer_reviews.text: In Southwest Colorado the weeds grow better than the flowers! Thistle, Milkweed and all manner of thorny & prickly characters arise in days. Thorns make their way through thick leather gloves and assorted utensils are required to scoop them up after they're pulled. Not anymore! These gloves (One size fits all) are Amazing! I can pull anything effortlessly with many inches of roots...no splinters or stickers in my hands ever. Now anytime I see a weed emerging, I happily attend to it in one fell sweep. I want to weed now!!!! So easy peasy! I'm sure others will come up with more uses for these babies!
customer_reviews.author: Gwynne

customer_reviews.title: For the Dad that has everything
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Christmas my dad said one glove developed a hole. So his pair had a 7 month life. My pair purchased at same time still doing ok. Gave these to my dad for his birthday. He uses them all the time. Great for transferring the roast/bird from roaster to platter. Great for carving meat as you can grip the roast/bird with one gloved hand and carve with the other (ungloved) hand. No more roasts/birds sliding around. Then you can wash them right off.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Size Selection
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are excellent with the exception of difficulty of inserting your hand into the glove. What is listed as the most common size results in good fit if you are successful in inserting your hand into the glove. A fabric liner would be advantageous and I plan to purchase a pair of slim gloves to serve that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Poor insulation, melts at 450F
customer_reviews.text: These might be fine for grilling, and they might be OK for the claimed 425-deg F. However, I can attest that they will melt at 450-deg F in the time it takes to move a cast iron pan from the oven to the cooktop. The gloves have no insulation, so even in the span of the couple seconds my hand got scalded because these provide no thermal insulation. Again, these may be sufficient for grilling but I can not recommend them for cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Marilee

customer_reviews.title: Tight and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: First off the regular recommended size is very small, would only fit if you have tiny hands. Secondly, the inside has raised nubs throughout which make it very uncomfortable to wear. Returning now...
customer_reviews.author: DLosangeles

customer_reviews.title: Great for Big Hands. Not so great for mine
customer_reviews.text: I needed these. I wanted these. I got these. Then I tried them on. I have small hands and got the smallest size. Unfortunately, for the glove to work, there has to be a goodly about of Silicone between the person and the hot thing. These ended up being too cumbersome for my little hands. Envision a kid trying to pick up something wearing extra thick work gloves. I hope they'll come out with gloves that do fit me, as I'm a klutz. I'm typing this with a burn blister from the oven on one finger ...
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great for handling hot things
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my spouse but these are awesome. It's a little scary reaching into the oven to grab a hot heavy pan with these thin gloves the first time but it's much easier to grab ahold and actually grip the pan. I feel zero heat increase on my hands and they do not absorb spills. Very pleased with the purchase, I may get myself a pair for the garage...
customer_reviews.author: Michael bates

customer_reviews.title: Why does this have so many positive reviews ??
customer_reviews.text: Can’t hold a hot product for more than a couple of seconds ! Don’t know why in the world it has so many positive reviews ! Don’t believe me, buy and it see for yourself, you can barely hold something which has been on stove for a few seconds before feeling heat through the glove, yes the heat permeates through and you could potentially get burnt. Not worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: T Patel

customer_reviews.title: Great versitile gloves that I anticipate lasting for a long time
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are thick yet flexible. So far I've used these for maneuvering a hot cast iron skillet, and pulling items out of the oven. Something I haven't used them for yet is retrieving food from boiling water, but I plan on using them for this in the future. Was surprised at the large size of the one size fits most. I have pretty big hands and they fit me snug and nice, but were a bit large for my wife. On the plus side for her, it's easier to get her hands in and out of these quickly, where I have to work at it a bit.
customer_reviews.author: reedsdomain

customer_reviews.title: Transfers heat to the inside and makes my hands sweat
customer_reviews.text: I used these gloves while camping and ended up using them as hot pads instead of wearing them. The first morning breakfast ended with a hot and clammy interior. Initially the gloves do their job, protecting hands from heat. Within a few seconds of holding a hot pan the heat begins to seep in quickly. The same is true when working with cast iron pans over an outdoor wood fire - the heat begins to really start roasting hands. An inner fabric liner would help a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Olykwik

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be good quality, but difficult to grasp heavy items
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be of good quality, but in practice it is not easy to handle items when wearing these. I suppose it's a matter of fit. If it fits more "like a glove", then you'll have better control of carrying things. It it wears big, then you feel like you'll drop things. So this sits on the rack while the old-fashioned cloth oven mittens gets used.
customer_reviews.author: JustMyTwoCents

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are everything that I expected from the description and other reviews. I smoked meat yesterday, and used these gloves instead of the hooks used to remove the meat from their hanging racks. I couldn't feel any heat, I had 100% grip (on one occasion, I dropped a chicken down into the coals, using the hooks! That won't happen with these gloves), and I could then handle the meat safely for slicing and serving. Because of the make-up of the gloves, I wasn't worried about contaminating the meat with chemicals. Clean up was easy, but a bit of glazed BBQ sauce was slightly difficult to get out of the grippers. Next time, I'll use a soft brush, if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Eilers

customer_reviews.title: Hands of the Gods
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only used them a couple times instead of my oven mitts and I can say that they are hands down better against heat than your typical cloth oven mitts. Yes you will still feel some heat thru them but its a lot less. Just remember they are rated to 425. I will really put these to the test when I do ribs and brisket on the smoker in a few weeks. The quality is excellent and how can you go wrong with a lifetime replacement. If you don't any kind of serious grilling or normal kitchen cooking just get them. you wont regret it!
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Mann

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Stands the Heat!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is really into smoking meat and grilling so these were a perfect present. They are well made and stand the heat. He can pick up a whole slap of ribs right of the smoker and doesn't feel a thing! They only complaint he has is "the one size fits most" is a little big especially in the areas for your fingers- it is hard for him to use grilling utensils as he has no grip. This isn't a huge issue because he usually just takes them off during that time.
customer_reviews.author: GA

customer_reviews.title: Superb Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Seller responded to my email with a question and advice. Immediate response and overwhelming satisfaction. This product is of very high quality and provides the solutions it is intended for. Purchase this product without hesitation and you will be very happy. Once again - Superb Customer Service!
customer_reviews.author: J. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Melts onto hot items / Limited heat protection
customer_reviews.text: They do protect your hands from the heat. However I noticed when removing my heat defector from my grill the gloves appeared to melt onto the heat deflector. I could see orange on my heat deflector from the glove. This can't be good. Update: Now that I've used them for a while I've noticed they only protect you from heat for a very short time. When lifting a skillet from a 375 degree oven i could feel the heat after only 10 seconds. Not good!
customer_reviews.author: H-Bar

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. Gloves are somewhat thicker than I expected but the textured surface allows for a great grip. I found them very easy to clean up after use. Because of the great grip, I will also be using them as oven mitts. Flipping a turkey upside down in a roasting pan will be much easier and safer with these. I have had problems with regular oven mitts allowing liquid to pass through, not going to happen with these. Great product, super easy to clean up after use.
customer_reviews.author: Penchance

customer_reviews.title: Big.  Eventually developed a hole between thumb and pointer fingers.
customer_reviews.text: We've had these about three years now, and they've been great until recently when we realized the hard way that the area between the thumb and pointer finger had worn down until there was a hole. It took a few minor burns before I realized there was a tiny hole in each of them. I'm just glad we didn't find out by reaching into boiling water! Three years of use before getting the holes isn't bad, though. Now I'm trying to decide if I should get the same ones again, or different ones. They are definitely large for being "one size fits most."
customer_reviews.author: McDaniel127

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for pellet grill!
customer_reviews.text: Ive only used the once, but can tell they are worth it by far. I do lose some dexterity, but it is traded for better heat protection as well as ease of cleaning. I can adjust my temp probes and remove and replace racks on a hot grill with ease. Would use over other cloth type heat gloves any day. I usually wear a medium size glove and picked the "fits most" . Might be a little big, but not bad enough to care.
customer_reviews.author: Cole David Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product and Great Service
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves to BBQ. They work well to check on and move food from the grill to the table without having to use hot pads or towels that will stain or stick to your food. They clean up easily. They can be a little challenging to take off when they are wet; I recommend you get a size that is a little bigger than normal, they won’t fall off while you are using them but that extra space lets you take them off. I actually damaged my first pair of gloves and their customer service was amazing. They (Natalie) were responsive and stood by their quality guarantee and replaced my gloves at no charge and no questions asked.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: Works great for handling hot items. Cleans easily, I just leave them on my hands add some dish soap and scrub them just like washing my hands. Only down side they are hard to pull on and pull off because they stick, or cling to your skin.
customer_reviews.author: J.H.R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gripping and insulation!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son who occassionally carries a large marble slab from a basement freezer to their kitchen for pastry work. The gloves are fantastic for both gripping and for insulation! Later, he used them to directly pick up a large turkey off of the stand after smoking it in his outdoor cooker. Again, excellent grip and great insulation! Lastly, they were used to place and remove cookie sheets from a hot oven. We were so impressed that we bought a set for ourselves. They fit my smaller hands and my husband's larger ones. Not sized for kids or if hands are extra large but great otherwise. Will be giving more as gifts!
customer_reviews.author: from Virginia

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! These Gloves Come Apart and You Will Get Burned!!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have a serious defect where they start coming apart between the thumb and the index finger. This resulted in severe burns on my right hand when I grabbed a hot tray. I inspected both gloves and found that they each were coming apart at the exact same spot where the silicon is thinnest. I bought the gloves over a year ago, but rarely grilled or baked. I imagined lightly used silicon would be able to stored and not degrade so quickly. They certainly don't last long, and I will never buy these gloves again, especially not after suffering terrible pain from just trying to cook a meal.
customer_reviews.author: aplayongallo

customer_reviews.title: BBQ or kitchen so versatile
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves as a gift for my father in law. He couldn't stop commenting on how great they were to use. He has been using them inside in the kitchen and couldn't wait to put them to use over the 4th of July family BBQ. They worked great on the grill when put to the test. The gloves kept his hands and part of his arms from getting hot when he was flipping chicken which made managing the BBQ so much more comfortable. They also helped with gripping serving platters. The gloves were passed around for others to try and see how well they worked. What I liked was the bright orange color. They were a real hit.
customer_reviews.author: Faten H Barranti

customer_reviews.title: Good Service!
customer_reviews.text: The gloves were just as described and arrived quickly. They fit my hands well (I'm an average size male) and allowed me to handle the heat from pulling pork without trouble. Be aware that the silicone becomes very slippery once the oil from the meat coats them. Holding onto things or getting them off becomes difficult but they do what I bought for, pulling pork.
customer_reviews.author: sseverett

customer_reviews.title: Burned Hand!
customer_reviews.text: Burned hand due to tear in glove between thumb and index finger. Second glove showing similar wear. These were excellent at first, but didn't hold up well. At first, I didn't realize that a hole had developed and was surprised when I felt burn. So unexpected was the burn, that I was sure, at first, that I had used them improperly. Disappointed. Would have been solid 4-5 stars, but safety and durability are paramount.
customer_reviews.author: SML

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was hoping for. When picking up a finished piece of meat off the grill, I can feel the heat instantly and the heat remains from the oils that get on the gloves, which I then have to remove the gloves very quickly as my hands are burning at that point. I washed them by hand the first couple uses, which required lots of scrubbing, and then finally washed them in the dishwasher as the instructions says you can, and well they came out still dirty. I'll be retiring these gloves from BBQing and hopefully will find another use of them.
customer_reviews.author: John Wozniak

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and keep your hands from getting burnt.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a Z grill smoker and was in need of a pair of bbq gloves. I looked around on the web and saw these gloves. I wanted something that had grip, was heat resistant, and easy to clean. Also being flexible enough to feel my probes in my hand to. After using these while smoking my brisket I must say they work well. I recommend these to all people who are in need of a good pair of bbq gloves.
customer_reviews.author: tweedter

customer_reviews.title: Finally non blanched fingers
customer_reviews.text: Ok let's say I love these, every week I cook 300lbs of crawfish in a basket system, every week I have left with blanched knuckles but no more The last two times have been a pleasure no more steam burns and made life so much better. As mentioned by the vendor immersion in hot liquids are not advised but I have grabbed the bag of spuds from the boiling pot, silicone is a poor conductor of heat so the nibs keep the hot product from getting close to the skin, but if immersed the thinner silicone will reduce the temp but only for a short time. Would recommend these anytime
customer_reviews.author: andrew fison

customer_reviews.title: Solid hand protection
customer_reviews.text: If you put both on and pick up a fatty pork out of a smoker, good luck getting them off... Aside from that, they fit great and work very well. I do feel it is worth mentioning that, like aluminized clothing, when the heat penetrates the gloves, it is too late. They aren't the most agile gloves to wear but they aren't meant for doing fine movements. Get in, get out and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: daled

customer_reviews.title: Review update
customer_reviews.text: 4 reasons i gave them away after i tolerated them for too long...i just bought another brand 1. too slippery handeling meat, 2. needed to use teeth and pull fingers to yank them off, 3. hard to clean spices and sauce lodged in grip divets, 4. couldnt hold my grates for 15 seconds while i spritz food
customer_reviews.author: RICHDNJ

customer_reviews.title: They work very well, but the one size fits ...
customer_reviews.text: They work very well. Keep in mind that the fingers are really short in the one size fits most, so if you have adult size hands, get the larger size. If you have issues with the product just contact their customer service. They are a delightful bunch of people. Update: Now granted I've had these for 4 years now and they've been great, but they have developed holes where the thumb and pointer fi get meet, right in the crease causing me to burn myself since I didn't notice. I'm buying another pair because they are great, but just inspect yours after a few years and toss them before you get burned.
customer_reviews.author: Jeavis

customer_reviews.title: They're as great as everyone says
customer_reviews.text: I have more dexterity than I thought I would have. They handle heat better than I thought they would. I got the leading thermal gloves, too, for really hot stuff. Except for fire and coals, there's no surface I can't touch on my 22" WSM. They are a tad bit more slippery than I expected given the textured surface. But they quickly rinse clean in water. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: crittah

customer_reviews.title: Great quality qroduct, but hard to remove when greasy!
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about these gloves. Pros: Thick and protect your hands well. The quality of the material and finish is second to none. Cons: I use these to handle meat in a meat smoker, which means a lot of grease and mess while foiling the meat, basting, etc. While the product is great to protect my hands from the meats, it is incredibly hard to get the gloves off while they are coated in grease. It would be helpful if there was a loop or something to grab one glove with the other and at least start to remove one glove with the other. I wouldn't let this detract from buying them, just sharing my experience.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: They work as advertised with hot items. My only two complaints are (1) that can be difficult to take off, especially if you have both of them on and they get wet in any way, and (2) they are not as easy as we had thought they'd be to clean, especially when you get black grease marks on them from the grill. But they weren't very expensive and I can imagine the many uses we'll find for these. They also appear to be made to last, so I'm calling this a decent value.
customer_reviews.author: C. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Awesome company and product
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic company and high quality product! I haven't used the gloves yet, but they were packaged well and look like a very good quality product. I was impressed with just the feel of the material. It is so substantial. The company, too, seems to be wonderful. They have contacted me by email to offer additional uses and information. I would definitely purchase from this company again and look forward to using the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: dakotadreamer

customer_reviews.title: Ribs on the ground = bad gloves
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband for Christmas since he loves grilling. From him: Pros: Easy to clean, dishwasher safe Cons: If you're working close to high heat, they get very hot inside and make your fingers burn. You can only really use these over medium temperatures. The worst part was he was trying to take ribs off the grill while wearing these, and they got so hot that he dropped half a slab of ribs on the ground! That alone knocked off 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Blu

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are thick silicone, with a texture that give you a good grip on food or pan. they do get a little warm inside but when handling food at 500 degrees that is expected. I will get good use of these.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: You NEED these!
customer_reviews.text: If you do much smoking in a smoker you know how difficult it can be sometimes to remove the meat from a smoker. These are definitely the gloves you need. So easy. Only con: they are a little big but as long as he doesn't get burnt he is ok!!
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: These are worth purchaseing! Just bought in early January, so haven't been using them for long. However, they're great for the kitchen (stove and pulling things out of the oven). Just used for the first time last night at the grill - everything they promised it would be. My only negative, and it wasn't bad enough to reduce from 5 star. I have somewhat petite hands and wish these came in a size smaller (versus one size fits all). They can be a bit awkward. However, all oven mitts I've ever used are a bit large, so this is common for me. Still glad I purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy R

customer_reviews.title: These are the gloves you need!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves because I wanted to start to use my Rotisserie on my grill. I needed gloves in order to remove the spit from the rotisserie, and then the chicken, or meat from the spit. These gloves work great. They are heat resistant, and make it easy to grip the food.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Epstein

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy again!
customer_reviews.text: They are large on your hands making it a little awkward to use. I find them a little hard to take off and if you get any oil on them, they are slippery. I still feel a lot of heat through them. They work but I probably won't buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Let’s the heat right on through.
customer_reviews.text: Ouch!! I deal with cast iron a lot and can’t grab the handles with these without feeling a lot of heat. I have to replace them. They are durable and easy to clean, but if I feel pain then what is the point?
customer_reviews.author: HORSE LOVER

customer_reviews.title: Great glove but odd sizes.
customer_reviews.text: Really effective for using in grilling or baking. Bought them for grilling. When I need to turn a pork shoulder or reposition a turkey, these will allow me to directly grab the food, no slipping, no burnt hands, no worries using these gloves. The size and fit is a little odd. I normally wear med to large winter gloves. Originally bought the large/XL but I was swimming in them. I did like the longer sleeve length but was concerned about handling food and the large size slipping. These are 'fits most' but are almost tight. However, I feel handling food is a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Vintner Don

customer_reviews.title: Fit is tight but fingers a little long
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these since I currently use Lodge gloves that I use for handling dutch ovens and barbecuing. They work for handling food but I have to take them off and put them back on a lot since they are bulkier and more difficult to use vs. the Lodge leather gloves. After using them a few times, I found that using one for handling food and the other bare hand for tongs,, etc works best. They seem like a good quality product but due to the fit, I marked them down a star.
customer_reviews.author: Typical Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Heck yea!
customer_reviews.text: Must have! Hubby likes to say I have asbestos hands, but these gloves outshine anything I've ever used. Just for fun I tried pulling eggs out of boiling water - didn't feel anything! Also pulled apart a chicken from the smoker and again barely noticed a difference in the temperature. They say you can put them in the dishwasher (I believe it), but I've been happy just sudging up with dish soap and cleaning them like I'm washing my hands
customer_reviews.author: Howza

customer_reviews.title: Even answered my questions on Sunday.
customer_reviews.text: Company is very honest and stands behind their product. Heat resistance is superb, grip on greasy food is very good and easy to use. Great product, both company and gloves are highly recommended. If you have a large hand make sure you order the larger gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Need to flip your Thanksgiving turkey? Want a good grip and little clean-up? Perfect gloves for the job!
customer_reviews.text: I really like how well these grip as well as how easy and quick it is to clean. Anytime I have a particularly messy dish to deal with (such as flipping that roasting thanksgiving turkey) I know these gloves will allow me a solid grip. Just a quick rinse and scrub and they're good to go again. The "one size fits most" is a tad big for me (petite female here) - but I guess that's to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn

customer_reviews.title: Works great but runs small
customer_reviews.text: My husband's hands barely fit in these things but they worked perfectly for turning and removing pork shoulders on the smoker without damaging the crust or shredding the meat. They're also extremely easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Fraggle

customer_reviews.title: Slippery grip
customer_reviews.text: These gloves do not grip well... They become very slippery from the steam or juices that splatter on them.. They are extremely bad when trying to grip glass containers like casserole dishes.. When the gloves has cracked around the crotch of the thumb area. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Great for handling meat, not pans.
customer_reviews.text: Great for pulling meat of the bbq/smoker. Good for holding onto large cuts while you trim it out. Though, once they get greasy, they really are hard to get off. I can't say that I'd recommend these to hold hot pans for any length of time - there is no insulation in them, so heat does travel through relatively quickly. I have a standard set of silicone mitts with quilted insulation inside, those work much better for pulling pans out of the oven. For me, these are meat handling gloves, and they work perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: Scothra

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: These work great for their intended purpose. They are a bit clumsy but don't know that you could fix that due to the nature of the product. The sizing was a bit confusing when ordering. I had to read a lot of reviews before I figured out which size to buy. Ended up with the "one size fits most". I am an average size person & they fit as good as can be expected in this type of glove. As with any heat proof glove, they are a bit slippery but have little raised grips all over making them less slippery than the last pair I owned. All that being said, I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: keg

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, good guality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband who needs the occasional protection and dexterity that quilted mitts just can not give him. They are a bit tight around the palms but the finger lengths are just right. Gloves arrived 3 days ago, and wouldn't you know, it's been rainy ever since! Vendor very good about communicating assurance he is ready to assist with any problem or concern we may have (which we do not). He also sent additional safe grilling tips!
customer_reviews.author: Nallie

customer_reviews.title: Good for oven and BBQ use
customer_reviews.text: These are an excellent replacement for old school quilted oven gloves. They are heat resistant and I found the grip to be quite good. they will help keep hot liguid splashes off your hands. You need to be aware, they will eventually get hot and transfer burning heat to skin, so use common sense. If you wear a men's size large glove, the "one size fits many" may be too tight. On my hand, they were snug and restricted movement more than I liked, but the folks at Jolly Green Products were incredibly responsive and helped me sort it all out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: zramix

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds all expectations! 6/5 stars A+++ Customer Care!
customer_reviews.text: I have tested these out and they are very nice! Was able to remove a grate from the smoker and carried it for a min or so at 275 with 0 heat transfer to my hands . Also used these to remove the steaks (who needs tongs use your hands) from the smoker. I then seared the steaks in a cast iron skillet on high heat probably 425-475 with again 0 heat transfer from handle to hand. These are wonderful! Heat protection- 5/5 Grip 4/5 (a little slick) Fit 4/5 (can be tough to put on) Quality 5/5 Customer service 10/5 (beyond wonderful, greatly exceeds expectations) Overall 6/5 (again meets and exceeds expectations)
customer_reviews.author: Mota

customer_reviews.title: I found an alternative use for these!
customer_reviews.text: These work great for the use for which they were intended. My only issue is that I was unable to get them small enough to really fit me well. What I soon discovered, was many alternate uses. When faced with a problem getting a grip on items like jar lid, light bulbs, and even the screw off globe to my kitchen light fixture, I found that donning these gloves makes the twist successful. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: LAURA

customer_reviews.title: They are ok. They are a little bulky which ...
customer_reviews.text: They are ok. They are a little bulky which makes it hard to pick things up or use utensils. Can still feel a little heat Seller refunded my money for the gloves without asking since we were not completely happy with them. She pointed out that since they are one size fits all that they may not always fit everyone. The customer service was very nice considering I wasn't asking for anything :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found them and they work so well!
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Husband got burnt pouring pasta with Ov glove and we looked for a better product. Found it with the Ekogrips. Fingers allow for flexibility and that helps a lot. Pouring pasta, using the rotisserie, smoker, etc. prefer these to the Orca mitt we have used because those were ungainly. I have small hands and the One Size style works for me. Husband has larger hands (piano player 10 key spread) and fits the One Size, but takes time to get in and out of so the L/XL size is better option for him. Really like them and will recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: avid reader

customer_reviews.title: looks like I am ordering a second pair
customer_reviews.text: I wish that I had known about the Ekogrip silicone heat gloves long before now , I had second degree burns on my wrist while taking out hot beef and gravy from the microwave , if I had these on , it never would have happened ! My husband has tried to take mine , looks like I am ordering a second pair , I also want to check out the bake ware ! Thank you for a fabulous product , I will be back for more..........
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: They seem sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: I've used these gloves about a dozen times over a couple months. They seem sturdy and well made. They protect the hands from hot dishes reasonably well, but there is a limit to the thermal protection one can expect from silicone insulation of this thickness. When lifting a hot item, such as a roasted turkey, they function well. My only reservation is their grip after handling something like a turkey. When grease or oil from food gets on the gloves, it is a bit difficult to hold a boning or carving knife securely. Washing the gloves frequently while carving helps.
customer_reviews.author: DWK

customer_reviews.title: Burned 4 Fingers
customer_reviews.text: on my right hand taking my pizza stone out of the oven at 400 degrees. Do not rely upon these gloves. I suspect there are areas in the pattern that do not protect as they should.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: The Ekogrips silicone gloves are as described. You are not likely to lose or misplace them. The orange color almost speaks to you. One size fits all and they are truly heat resistant.. Don't try moving hot oven racks with a hot pad or mitten.. No problem with the Ekogrips. The unique design, with tiny bumps, makes them virtually slip proof. Just a little talc aids in putting them on and removing them. Other than that no hassles. They are dishwasher safe. A great time saver. Would you believe a lifetime guarantee? We bought an extra pair as a gift for someone who loves grilling outdoors
customer_reviews.author: Bob Jetski

customer_reviews.title: Great product! But wears out easily.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these Ekogrips for protection from heat, as I make home made saltwater taffy. These gloves allow me to begin the taffy-pulling process much earlier than I could without heat-resistant gloves. I make one or two batches per month to keep honing my craft, and the heavy use and wear from continuously pulling taffy wore out the rubber between the thumb and forefinger. Luckily I noticed when it occurred, otherwise I could have been badly burned by the sugar mixture I was handling. UPDATE: The manufacturer reached out to me, refunded me the total of the order and you better believe I'll be getting a replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Tanner H

customer_reviews.title: just get them

I had the chance to get a hold of there extra large version (which has stars instead of hearts!) and there easily doubled the size making any large hand a nice fit. for doing small things they dont work the best but for chicken breasts ribs rumps anything large there just simply is not substitute for a large set of gloves, no more tongs bending and dropping it just pick it up move it go on with ur grilling/smoking! highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my husband and he loves them. He is a big guy with large hands and the gloves give him good coverage on his arms and fit him perfectly. He likes that they give good heat protection. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: SarMar

customer_reviews.title: Great glove and customer service!
customer_reviews.text: The glove is great for my baking hobby. No more dirty dish towels or oven mitts for handling hot pans, now I just this glove to touch any hot surface. I would definitely recommend this glove to friends.
customer_reviews.author: GizmoTotoro

customer_reviews.title: Fingers are short
customer_reviews.text: I bought one size fits most. I bought these to use to remove hot items out of my toaster oven. The reason I only give it 4 stars is I don't think the fingers are long enough. I am concerned that they could rip later as they do not go down to the skin between the fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C

customer_reviews.title: These are a great gift and multipurpose...
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent grilling gloves. I like that they come a little longer on your arm. They keep heat out pretty well unless your holding something hot for an extended amount of time. Being able to shred meat immediately after it has been cooked is my favorite. You can quickly grab from boiling water. I like using one glove to hold something hot I'm cutting and my other hand is free to cut. Grabbing bread from the oven is so easy. These are great gloves and I bought one as a gift my friend.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Safely Protects
customer_reviews.text: Although cumbersome, these gloves are great for protection while grilling. The are long enough that I don't chance burning my wrists or lower inner arms. I use them a lot. Made the mistake of leaving them outside and rain got inside them. Not easy to dry out as they are thick and cannot be turned inside-out. Despite this, I wouldn't take anything for them, especially when I'm doing tricky grilling like a whole boston butt.
customer_reviews.author: B W Gardner

customer_reviews.title: These gloves do not protect you from the heat. Find another kind that do a better job.
customer_reviews.text: These are good gloves. I only wish they would allow me to hold a hot item longer. After 5-10 seconds, I can feel the heat getting more intense, and I wish that didn't happen. I was hoping to feel no heat at all. After using these, I find they do not protect your hands from the heat. I need to use something else with it to keep from dropping the dish or pan while lifting it due to the excessive heat. I thought since Martha Stewart was endorsing these, the quality would be superior; however, this is not the case.
customer_reviews.author: JBH

customer_reviews.title: Toss out your old oven/barbecue mitts and gloves! There's a new glove in town!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just used them for the first time last night. Grilled fish in a huge cast iron pan in my Big Green Egg. customer_reviews.author: JASON R.

customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Seems to resist the heat pretty good unless you hold something real hot for long ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to resist the heat pretty good unless you hold something real hot for long periods of time. Then you’ll start to feel the heat start to increase.
